feed.title: Hermosawave Photography
feed.subtitle: A series of daily landscape photographs by Daniel Sofer, over 16 years running.

entry.title: Malaga Coast
entry.content: Cruising above Malaga Cove and Rat Beach in Palos Verdes Estates.
entry.summary: Cruising above Malaga Cove and Rat Beach in Palos Verdes Estates.

entry.title: Punk and Skate
entry.content: Celebrating Hermosa Beach's heritage of Punk and Skateboarding is this mural by Daniel Inez, on the side of the 13th St. parking structure.
entry.summary: Celebrating Hermosa Beach's heritage of Punk and Skateboarding is this mural by Daniel Inez, on the side of the 13th St. parking structure.

entry.title: Sunset at Flat Rock
entry.content: Looking out into the Pacific Ocean from above Bluff Cove in Palos Verdes.
entry.summary: Looking out into the Pacific Ocean from above Bluff Cove in Palos Verdes.

entry.title: Miso Cod with Soba Noodles
entry.content: Anniversary dinner at Wolfgang Puck’s 24 at the LA Live Center this evening.
entry.summary: Anniversary dinner at Wolfgang Puck’s 24 at the LA Live Center this evening.

entry.title: Shinjuku Trains • 新宿の電車
entry.content:
Something different on this last shot from Japan (for a while)...

Some of the many local trains going in and out of Tokyo's Shinjuku Station, in this multiple exposure.

More passengers than any station in the world pass through the hundreds of ticket gates spread across this sprawling station.
entry.summary: Something different on this last shot from Japan (for a while)... Some of the many local trains going in and out of Tokyo's Shinjuku Station, in this multiple exposure. More passengers than any station in the world pass through the hundreds of ticket gates spread across this sprawling station.

entry.title: Irises at Shinjuku Gyoen • 新宿御苑の菖蒲

link.title: Irises at Shinjuku Gyoen • 新宿御苑の菖蒲

entry.content: Irises today; this time at Shinjuku Gyoen, a large peaceful park just a few minutes walk from the world's busiest train station.
entry.summary: Irises today; this time at Shinjuku Gyoen, a large peaceful park just a few minutes walk from the world's busiest train station.

entry.title: Lilies at Meiji Jingu • 明治神宮の小百合

link.title: Lilies at Meiji Jingu • 明治神宮の小百合

entry.content: On a tip, went out to the Lily and Lotus gardens at Meiji Jingu in the pouring rain today.
entry.summary: On a tip, went out to the Lily and Lotus gardens at Meiji Jingu in the pouring rain today.

entry.title: Shibuya Afternoon • 午後の渋谷
entry.content: Looking west at central Shibuya from the Hikarie tower. At center bottom is the Shibuya Crossing.
entry.summary: Looking west at central Shibuya from the Hikarie tower. At center bottom is the Shibuya Crossing.

entry.title: Tokyo Station at Night • 東京駅丸の内口

link.title: Tokyo Station at Night • 東京駅丸の内口

entry.content:
Continuing our tour of Japan train stations, this is the Marunouchi side of Tokyo Station in the rain this evening.

Opened in 1914, damaged by US bombing during WWII, then finally restored to its original state in 2012, the Marunouchi Entrance is a beautiful example of Western-influenced Japanese architecture from the beginning of the 20th Century.

Tokyo Station is the main destination for intercity travel, but other stations in Tokyo have more traffic.
entry.summary: Continuing our tour of Japan train stations, this is the Marunouchi side of Tokyo Station in the rain this evening. Opened in 1914, damaged by US bombing during WWII, then finally restored to its original state in 2012, the Marunouchi Entrance is a beautiful example of Western-influenced Japanese architecture from the beginning of the 20th Century. Tokyo Station is the main destination for intercity travel, but other stations in Tokyo have more traffic.

entry.title: Osaka Station • 大阪駅
entry.content:
JR Osaka Station features a giant angled roof covering the tracks, higher on one side than the other; connected to several high rise towers, one of which features a small farm on the roof.

Together with the Hankyu Umeda station across the street, Osaka is the fourth busiest train station in the world.
entry.summary: JR Osaka Station features a giant angled roof covering the tracks, higher on one side than the other; connected to several high rise towers, one of which features a small farm on the roof. Together with the Hankyu Umeda station across the street, Osaka is the fourth busiest train station in the world.
